title: mozilla.org showing up in address bar when i type "m"
content:
This is relatively new. i have ALWAYS set my search settings so that it only shows my bookmarks and previously visited websites, and i have NEVER visited mozilla.org before now. i even install Firefox from an installer i get from a DIFFERENT PC.

So why now is Mozilla.org coming up as the FIRST result when i type the letter "M" on the keyboard?

i checked in Settings, under Search, and "Search Suggestions" are all unchecked, and the only things under "Address Bar" that are checked are "Browsing History" and "Bookmarks". And i already checked my bookmarks and deleted the newly added "Mozilla" folder (which must have been put there after an update), and History is empty, save for my few visited sites. Firefox is also set to "Never Remember History", so any NEW wesbite visits get wiped out after closing the window.

After typing "m", when mozilla.org came up in the results, i have hit Shift + Delete to remove it from the list, but as soon as i type "m" again, it's right back there!

i realize that it is self-serving for Mozilla to have themselves as a recommendation, but it clutters my view when i am looking for MY URLs; the ones that i visit regularly.

am i missing something? please tell me there is a way to turn this off...
creator: zzzz4444

title: My FireFox Browser does not display images when I am off-line although all images from the Church Website are on file
content:
Dear FireFox,

Christian greetings in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

In addition to being pastor, I am also the Webmaster for the Church Website for about 30 years and prepare a FREE Weekly Church Newsletter circulated worldwide with 1297 back-issues available for download.

When I draft and code the Newsletter I switch between TextPad (text editor) and Firefox off-line. Images should display offline or on-line as they are all on the Church Computer. I have experienced this problem for about three or four weeks.

Please assist me with this problem.

Any of hundreds of .jpg or .gif or .npg images. We have a desktop computer. I have reinstalled FireFox multiple times and it will no longer display images off-line. This is a relatively recent problem I have not suffered in 30-years. Google Chrome, Edge and Internet Explorer all display the images off-line.

I will be grateful if you will email me at ags@biblebelievers.

May God bless you.

Yours sincerely in the love and service of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Your brother-in-Christ, Anthony Grigor-Scott MINISTER OF THE GOSPEL http://www.biblebelievers.au/ Subscribe to Bible Believers' FREE Weekly Church Newsletter
creator: ags4

title: Computer reset and data saved on firefox was erased (bookmarks, passwords, etc). How do I get it back?
content:
I'm using a macbook air, and I was trying to use the fingerprint login thing, when instead of unlocking my puter it shut down the whole thing and it started to make very loud fan noises. I waited a few minutes for it to stop, then got back on, and my bookmarks and saved passwords were deleted from firefox. No passwords or logins were reset on any other applications. This is very alarming since I had just made an email and some accounts to manage some event I'm holding, and now the password I trusted to firefox is lost. I need this password, as otherwise I cannot log into my email since I hadn't time to set up recovery measures (I have tried to recover it, but there's insufficient evidence for google that I own the account :/ ).

I tried looking through my browsing history for anything helpful, but everything was deleted from there as well. I also was not logged into my Mozilla account at the time either, so I am really in some sort of predicament here, , I'd appreciate any advice and ideas here!!
creator: b0nes2852
